titlStmt.titl: What Albertan Adults Know About Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders (FASD) 2017

citation.biblCit: Hanson, Tara, 2018, "What Albertan Adults Know About Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders (FASD) 2017", https://doi.org/10.7939/DVN/LOSA60, UAL Dataverse, V2

titlStmt.titl: What Albertan Adults Know About Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders (FASD) 2017

prodStmt.prodPlac: Population Research Laboratory, University of Alberta, Edmonton, Canada

stdyInfo.abstract:
What Albertan Adults Know About Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders (FASD) 2017 is a computer-assisted telephone survey of 1200 Albertan adults. It is a portion of the 2017 Alberta Survey conducted by the Population Research Lab (PRL), and commissioned by PolicyWise for Children & Families (formerly the Alberta Centre for Child, Family and Community Research) and funded by Alberta Health. 16 questions were asked relating to general knowledge about Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder; personal experience relating to FASD; and attitudes concerning prevention.

These metadata can also be found on the SAGE metadata website:
http://sagemetadata.policywise.com/nada/index.php/catalog/15

dataAccs.notes:
We are accepting proposals for our 2018 Secondary Data Use Grant starting February 20, 2018. This grant provides $5,000 to successful applicants to undertake research using data in SAGE. The term of the grant is 12 months. The grant offers an excellent opportunity for trainees and new researchers to work with existing birth cohort and survey data. Deadline for applications is April 27, 2018 at 4:00 PM MST

No special access conditions or procedures beyond the standard SAGE data access protocol: https://policywise.com/initiatives/sage/accessing-data/. Contact: data@policywise.com
